pullRequest.body:
This PR splits `Data.Fintype.Card` based on dependencies:
* `Data.Fintype.Card` contains the definition of `Fintype.card` and basic results
* `Data.Fintype.EquivFin` contains the equivalences between fintypes, finiteness and `Fin`
* `Data.Fintype.Pigeonhole` contains a few pigeonhole principles
* `Data.Fintype.Group` gets a few extra results on `Additive`/`Multiplicative`

---

- [x] depends on: #21831

I'm confused, how did the dependencies for `Mathlib.Algebra.Group.TypeTags.Fintype` *increase* due to the split (by 16, when the split was only 4-way)?

> I'm confused, how did the dependencies for `Mathlib.Algebra.Group.TypeTags.Fintype` _increase_ due to the split (by 16, when the split was only 4-way)?

I redid the import order so `TypeTags.Fintype` now imports `Fintype.Card` instead of the other way around. Although `Fintype.Card` reduced from 478 to 423 imports, that's still more than `Fintype.OfMap` used to have.
I think since `TypeTags.Fintype` didn't cause any downstream increases, one `+16` is a fine tradeoff for the other decreases.

Thanks!

maintainer delegate
Looks like copy-pasta

```suggestion
instance Set.instFinite [Finite α] : Finite (Set α) := by
```
Shouldn't that be closer to the `Fintype (Fin n)` instance?
We can indeed upstream it to `Fintype/Card.lean` itself, since that imports `Fintype/Basic.lean` which holds the `Fintype (Fin n)` instance.
All of this can be moved earlier, I believe
You are completely correct, these now live together with `Fintype.card_fin` into their own section in `Fintype.Card`.

pullRequest.title: chore(Data/Fintype): split `Fintype/Card.lean`

source.title: chore(Data/Finset): don't import algebra when defining `Finset.card`

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#21831~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (🤖). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
I'm confused, how did the dependencies for `Mathlib.Algebra.Group.TypeTags.Fintype` *increase* due to the split (by 16, when the split was only 4-way)?

> I'm confused, how did the dependencies for `Mathlib.Algebra.Group.TypeTags.Fintype` _increase_ due to the split (by 16, when the split was only 4-way)?

I redid the import order so `TypeTags.Fintype` now imports `Fintype.Card` instead of the other way around. Although `Fintype.Card` reduced from 478 to 423 imports, that's still more than `Fintype.OfMap` used to have.
I think since `TypeTags.Fintype` didn't cause any downstream increases, one `+16` is a fine tradeoff for the other decreases.

Thanks!
